**Jigsaw** (**William "Billy" Russo**, also known as **Billy "The Beaut"
Russo** before his disfigurement) is a [fictional
character](/wiki/Fictional_character "Fictional character"),
[gangster](/wiki/Gangster "Gangster"), and [supervillain](/wiki/Supervillain
"Supervillain") appearing in [American comic books](/wiki/American_comic_book
"American comic book") published by [Marvel Comics](/wiki/Marvel_Comics
"Marvel Comics"). Created by [Len Wein](/wiki/Len_Wein "Len Wein") and [Ross
Andru](/wiki/Ross_Andru "Ross Andru"), the character made his first full
appearance in _[The Amazing Spider-Man](/wiki/The_Amazing_Spider-Man "The
Amazing Spider-Man")_ #162 (November [1976](/wiki/1976_in_comics "1976 in
comics")).

## Publication
history[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Publication history")]

Jigsaw debuted in _[The Amazing Spider-Man](/wiki/The_Amazing_Spider-Man "The
Amazing Spider-Man")_ #161–162, returning in _The Amazing Spider-Man_ #188,
and _[The Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(1986_series\) "The Punisher \(1986
series\)")_ #1 and #4–5. Jigsaw then allied with [the
Rev](/wiki/Rev_\(comics\) "Rev \(comics\)") in _[The
Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(1987_series\) "The Punisher \(1987 series\)")_
Vol. 2, #35–40, and Gregario in #55–56. Following a cameo appearance in _[The
Punisher War Journal](/wiki/The_Punisher_War_Journal "The Punisher War
Journal")_ #61, Jigsaw's origin was detailed in Issues #3–4 of the prequel
[limited series](/wiki/Limited_series_\(comics\) "Limited series \(comics\)")
_The Punisher: Year One_ , and he furthered bedeviled the Punisher in
_[Punisher](/wiki/Punisher_\(1995_series\) "Punisher \(1995 series\)")_ Vol.
3, #2–4 and #9–10.

Proceeding an encounter with the eponymous character in
_[Daredevil](/wiki/Daredevil_\(Marvel_Comics_series\) "Daredevil \(Marvel
Comics series\)")_ Vol. 2, #61–64, Jigsaw appeared in _[The New
Avengers](/wiki/The_New_Avengers_\(comics\) "The New Avengers \(comics\)")_
#1–3, #35, #46, #50, #57, and _The New Avengers Annual_ #2; concurrent to his
appearances in that title, Jigsaw also starred in _Punisher War Journal_ Vol.
2, #11, #18–20, and #22–23. He was then featured in the five-issue miniseries
_[Punisher: In the Blood](/wiki/Punisher:_In_the_Blood "Punisher: In the
Blood")_ , and made a subsequent cameo in the
_[Thunderbolts](/wiki/Thunderbolts_\(comics\)#Marvel_NOW! "Thunderbolts
\(comics\)")_ Vol. 2 Annual.

Jigsaw received profiles in _The[Official Handbook of the Marvel
Universe](/wiki/Official_Handbook_of_the_Marvel_Universe "Official Handbook of
the Marvel Universe")_ #6, _The Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe
Master Edition_ #10, _Marvel Encyclopedia_ #4 and #5, _[The New
Avengers](/wiki/The_New_Avengers_\(comics\) "The New Avengers \(comics\)")
Most Wanted Files_ #1, and _Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A–Z_ #6.

## Fictional character
biography[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Fictional character biography")]

Billy Russo was born to a poor [Italian-American](/wiki/Italian-American
"Italian-American") family, kicked out and abandoned as an orphan by his
abusive father at the age of ten,[2] and went on to become a
[hitman](/wiki/Contract_killing "Contract killing") for New York's [Italian
criminal underworld](/wiki/Italian-American_Mafia "Italian-American Mafia"),
where his good looks garnered him the nickname "the Beaut".[3] He also married
a woman named Susan, and would beat both her and their son,
[Henry](/wiki/Henry_Russo "Henry Russo"), once forcing Henry to drown his pet
cat's kittens by threatening to shoot Susan.[2] After the botched gangland
execution that inadvertently led to the Castle family being massacred, Russo
is hired by [Frank Costa](/wiki/Olivier_\(comics\) "Olivier \(comics\)") to
assassinate all those connected to the Castles. Russo kills all of his targets
but Frank Castle, who survives the bomb that Russo had planted in Castle's
home.[4] Hours later, the [Punisher](/wiki/Punisher "Punisher") (Frank Castle)
tracks Russo down to a [Maggia](/wiki/Maggia_\(comics\) "Maggia \(comics\)")
[nightclub](/wiki/Nightclub "Nightclub"). The Punisher guns down all of
Russo's associates, but leaves him alive to send a message to organized crime
after knocking him through a glass pane, an act that reduces Russo's face to a
[jigsaw puzzle](/wiki/Jigsaw_puzzle "Jigsaw puzzle")-like mess of scars.[3]

Taking advantage of his hideous visage, the formerly handsome gangster adopts
the identity of Jigsaw, and attempts to frame the Punisher for murder.
However, the plan fails due to the intervention of [Spider-Man](/wiki/Spider-
Man "Spider-Man") and [Nightcrawler](/wiki/Nightcrawler_\(comics\)
"Nightcrawler \(comics\)"); Spider-Man witnesses one of Jigsaw's murders, and
one of his victims is an old friend of Nightcrawler.[5][6] Jigsaw later
battled Spider-Man again.[7]

It is revealed in the first _Punisher_ miniseries that Jigsaw was behind a
plan to drug the Punisher, causing his enemy to behave erratically and attack
any criminals, even for things as minor as littering. Jigsaw also attempts to
kill the Punisher in prison. The Punisher confronts and defeats him, and later
stops Jigsaw from escaping in a prison riot.[8] Later in the series, Jigsaw is
brainwashed by the Trust into serving as a member of a Punisher-style
assassination squad. He manages to remember who he is after encountering
Castle once again, and attacks the Punisher. He is defeated once more.[9][10]

Jigsaw is broken out of Ryker's Island by the [Rev](/wiki/Rev_\(comics\) "Rev
\(comics\)") who has him supervise the importation of a sterility-inducing
[Venezuelan](/wiki/Venezuela "Venezuela") drug that the Rev intends to test in
New York City. When the drug shipment is destroyed by the Punisher, Jigsaw
sics a street gang on him, and flees to Venezuela with the Rev. After Jigsaw's
face is healed by the Rev's powers, he is shot by the Punisher, but
resurrected by the Rev, with the assistance of
[Belasco](/wiki/Belasco_\(comics\) "Belasco \(comics\)"). Jigsaw's restored
face is destroyed, and he is left for dead in the jungle in a later battle
with the Punisher.[11][12][13][14][15][16] Jigsaw recovers, and subsequently
attempts to illegally reenter the United States, but is arrested and returned
to Ryker's Island. When the Punisher is captured by the authorities and sent
to same prison, Jigsaw disfigures and tries to kill him, but the Punisher
survives, and escapes from Ryker's.[17][18]

After the Punisher is arrested and sentenced to death, Jigsaw dons a stylized
copy of his costume and embarks on a homicidal rampage, targeting all those
connected to the execution.[19][20] When the Punisher is revealed to still be
alive, an overjoyed Jigsaw attempts to kill him, but the Punisher overpowers
him with the assistance of
[Daredevil](/wiki/Daredevil_\(Marvel_Comics_character\) "Daredevil \(Marvel
Comics character\)").[21] Jigsaw later partners with various syndicates, and
lays siege to the estate of the Geraci crime family, which the Punisher had
become the reluctant [underboss](/wiki/Underboss "Underboss") of.[22] Jigsaw
and his allies abduct the Geracis, but they are saved by the Punisher, who
shoots Jigsaw in the head.[23]

Jigsaw next establishes a [gunrunning](/wiki/Arms_trafficking "Arms
trafficking") operation, which is broken up by Daredevil and [Black
Widow](/wiki/Black_Widow_\(Natasha_Romanova\) "Black Widow \(Natasha
Romanova\)"). When his attempt at negotiating with Daredevil (who had declared
himself the new [Kingpin](/wiki/Kingpin_\(character\) "Kingpin
\(character\)")) fails, Jigsaw seeks revenge by breaking into Daredevil's
home, where he is subdued by Black Widow.[24] Jigsaw is remanded to the Raft,
an island supervillain prison, which he escapes from (breaking Spider-Man's
arm in the process) when the facility is attacked by
[Electro](/wiki/Electro_\(Marvel_Comics\) "Electro \(Marvel Comics\)").[25]
Once free, Jigsaw tries to rob a bank, but is beaten by [Tigra](/wiki/Tigra
"Tigra"). This humiliation leads to his forming an alliance with the self-
proclaimed "super-villain Kingpin" the [Hood](/wiki/Hood_\(comics\) "Hood
\(comics\)"); together, Jigsaw and the Hood film themselves threatening and
torturing Tigra.[1] Later, Jigsaw takes part in the Hood's attack on the
[Sanctum Sanctorum](/wiki/Sanctum_Sanctorum "Sanctum Sanctorum"), where he
attempts to snipe [Jessica Jones](/wiki/Jessica_Jones "Jessica Jones") and
Danielle Cage, only to be foiled by Spider-Man.[26]

Jigsaw has resumed his vendetta against the Punisher, in the pages of
_Punisher: War Journal_. Now wearing a color-inverted mockup of the Punisher
costume, Jigsaw arranges for the brainwashing of a young auxiliary police
officer in the NYPD. Exploiting the naive cop's pathological "hero-worship"
complex, Jigsaw and his new psychiatrist girlfriend turn the young man into a
new version of the Punisher.[27]

After a battle on the [Brooklyn Bridge](/wiki/Brooklyn_Bridge "Brooklyn
Bridge") where the Punisher once again spares Jigsaw's life, Jigsaw is taken
into [S.H.I.E.L.D.](/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D. "S.H.I.E.L.D.") custody. While
imprisoned he is seemingly shot dead by the man that he and his girlfriend
(who was actually undercover S.H.I.E.L.D. agent [Lynn
Michaels](/wiki/Lynn_Michaels "Lynn Michaels")) had brainwashed.[28] Jigsaw
survived the attempt on his life, and was transferred to a "reprogramming
asylum" by [H.A.M.M.E.R.](/wiki/H.A.M.M.E.R. "H.A.M.M.E.R.")[29] He returns to
the Hood's Gang in _[Secret Invasion](/wiki/Secret_Invasion "Secret
Invasion")_ to assist in fending off the invading [Skrulls](/wiki/Skrull
"Skrull"), and rejoins again in _[Dark Reign](/wiki/Dark_Reign_\(comics\)
"Dark Reign \(comics\)")_ to help attack the [New
Avengers](/wiki/The_New_Avengers_\(comics\) "The New Avengers
\(comics\)").[30][31]

Jigsaw then partners with the similarly disfigured [Stuart
Clarke](/wiki/Rampage_\(Marvel_Comics\) "Rampage \(Marvel Comics\)").
Together, the "Jigsaw Brothers" hire [Lady Gorgon](/wiki/Lady_Gorgon "Lady
Gorgon") to impersonate Maria Castle while they manipulate Henry, the
Punisher's ally and Jigsaw's son, into helping them capture and kill the
Punisher. After betraying and murdering Clarke, Jigsaw battles the Punisher on
top of his own burning headquarters, only to fall through the roof of the
building and into the fire below.[29]

Jigsaw resurfaced when the pictures of he and Spider-Man were shown enjoying
ice cream cones together while under the thrall of [fairy](/wiki/Fairy
"Fairy") king Oberoth'M'Gozz.[32]

A recovered Jigsaw afterward appears in the _[Civil War II](/wiki/Civil_War_II
"Civil War II")_ storyline as one of the criminals that the Kingpin has
assembled to help him rebuild his New York empire.[33]

## Powers and
abilities[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Powers and abilities")]

Jigsaw is an athletic man with no superhuman powers. During his time in
prison, he was able to hone his physical strength to a level comparable to the
Punisher. He has extensive experience with street-fighting techniques, and
familiarity with a variety of weapons and criminal techniques. He carries
various handguns as needed. He has been known to wear a special exo-skeleton
in his outfits.

Though lacking any formal, military training, Jigsaw is an exceptional
strategist and tactician. His unorthodox pattern of operation makes him more
difficult for the Punisher to anticipate than the majority of Punisher's
enemies. Before Jigsaw was disfigured, he was a highly-charismatic leader and
criminal organizer, but after the accident, only the latter trait
remained.[34]

## Other
versions[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Other versions")]

###
2099[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: 2099")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/2/2f/Jigsaw2099.jpg/150px-
Jigsaw2099.jpg)](/wiki/File:Jigsaw2099.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Jigsaw2099.jpg "Enlarge")

Jigsaw 2099, on the cover of _The Punisher 2099_ #10 (November 1993). Art by
[Tod Morgan](/wiki/Tod_Morgan "Tod Morgan").

A [cyborg](/wiki/Cyborg "Cyborg") and the under-[capo](/wiki/Caporegime
"Caporegime") of a crime syndicate called Cyber-Nostra, **Multi-Fractor** is
the one to inform the group's leader, Fearmaster, of the existence of the new
[Punisher](/wiki/Punisher_2099 "Punisher 2099"), who Multi-Fractor encounters
for the first time while attempting to illegally demolish a decrepit
neighborhood inhabited by "[Decreds](/wiki/Untouchability
"Untouchability")".[35][36][37] Multi-Fractor survives his initial run-in with
the Punisher, who he encounters again while extorting [protection
money](/wiki/Protection_racket "Protection racket") from a Grav-Ball
Stadium.[38] When the Punisher gains the upper hand in the ensuing fight, a
trio of corrupt police officers come to Multi-Fractor's aid, providing him
with a power-enhancing device, which kills him when the Punisher rams the
machine into Multi-Fractor's chest.[39]

A mortician and a veterinarian resurrect Multi-Fractor as **Jigsaw 2099** , a
[Frankenstein's monster](/wiki/Frankenstein%27s_monster "Frankenstein's
monster")-like being made of machinery and body parts taken from animals.
Jigsaw attempts to get revenge on the Punisher, but is temporarily [flash
frozen](/wiki/Flash_freezing "Flash freezing") by the crime fighter,
psychologically tortured for information, and then imprisoned in the
Punisher's "Punishment Hotel".[40][41] Jigsaw is located and freed by
Fearmaster, and together the two try to execute the Punisher with his own
Molecular Disintegrator. When the machine is turned on, its fail-safes
activate, and blast Jigsaw.[42] Jigsaw is later discovered, taken captive, and
further augmented by a gang, which he massacres and escapes from before
rejoining Fearmaster.[43]

###
Crossovers[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Crossovers")]

Jigsaw appears in both [Batman](/wiki/Batman "Batman")/Punisher [intercompany
crossover](/wiki/Intercompany_crossover "Intercompany crossover") books. In
the first crossover, Jigsaw allies with the [Joker](/wiki/Joker_\(comics\)
"Joker \(comics\)") and they both fight the Punisher and [Batman (Jean Paul
Valley)](/wiki/Azrael_\(comics\) "Azrael \(comics\)").[44] In the sequel,
Jigsaw's face is repaired by one of the world's foremost plastic surgeons,
extorted by the Joker, whom Jigsaw allies with again to take over Gotham. At
the end of this crossover, Jigsaw's reconstructed face is destroyed by one of
the Punisher's [fragmentation grenades](/wiki/Fragmentation_grenade
"Fragmentation grenade"), and he is knocked out and left for the police by
[Batman](/wiki/Batman "Batman") (Bruce Wayne).[45] Jigsaw and the Punisher's
activities in Gotham are later recounted by Azrael, and
[Nightwing](/wiki/Dick_Grayson "Dick Grayson").[46][47]

When the [Amalgam Universe](/wiki/Amalgam_Comics "Amalgam Comics") came into
being as a result of the events of _[DC vs. Marvel](/wiki/DC_vs._Marvel "DC
vs. Marvel")_ , Jigsaw was merged with [Wonder Woman](/wiki/Wonder_Woman
"Wonder Woman") foe [Cheetah](/wiki/Cheetah_\(comics\) "Cheetah \(comics\)")
to form "Pelt-Man"; cursed by an ancient ritual to resemble a [big
cat](/wiki/Big_cat "Big cat"), Billy Minerva took his anger over his condition
out on beautiful people, mutilating their faces until he was located and
subdued by Trevor Castle and Diana Prince.[48][49]

### Earth
X[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Earth X")]

At some point, Jigsaw died, and was sent to the Realm of the Dead. When
[Captain Marvel](/wiki/Captain_Marvel_\(Mar-Vell\) "Captain Marvel \(Mar-
Vell\)") and [Thanos](/wiki/Thanos "Thanos") destroyed
[Death](/wiki/Death_\(Marvel_Comics\) "Death \(Marvel Comics\)") and created
Paradise, Jigsaw was among the many who came to realize that they were
actually deceased. Jigsaw rejected Paradise and remained in the Realm of the
Dead, where he and the [Jackal](/wiki/Jackal_\(Marvel_Comics\) "Jackal
\(Marvel Comics\)") took to tormenting the Punisher, who had committed
suicide, and was living in blissful ignorance with his equally unaware family.
Jigsaw and the Jackal's actions cause the Punisher to remember his death, and
drive a wedge between him and his disbelieving loved ones, who only come to
accept that they are dead much later. [Captain America](/wiki/Captain_America
"Captain America"), who had been sent by Paradise to bring others to it,
punishes Jigsaw and the Jackal by banishing them to a desolate region of the
Realm of the Dead.[50]

### Marvel
MAX[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: Marvel MAX")]

Jigsaw, operating under the alias **The Heavy** , appears in the "Girls in
White Dresses" storyline of _[The Punisher
MAX](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(2004_series\) "The Punisher \(2004 series\)")_. An
American [drug lord](/wiki/Drug_lord "Drug lord"), Jigsaw expands his empire
to Mexico, and has his affiliates within the country kidnap women from [border
towns](/wiki/Border_town "Border town") for use as disposable slave labor in
meth labs. When the families of the abducted and murdered women seek aid from
the Punisher, Jigsaw drives the crime fighter to suicidal despair by tricking
him into believing he had accidentally shot an innocent girl, though a last
minute epiphany prompts the Punisher into exhuming and performing an amateur
autopsy on the child, leading to the discovery that the bullet that ended her
life was not one of his own. The Punisher proceeds to destroy Jigsaw's Mexican
operation and free his captives, and during a subsequent fight between the two
archenemies the Punisher knocks Jigsaw out a window and onto the boxcar of a
passing train, leaving his fate ambiguous.[51]

[Bullseye](/wiki/Bullseye_\(comics\) "Bullseye \(comics\)") later researches
Jigsaw and other enemies of the Punisher, such as Barracuda, [Finn
Cooley](/wiki/List_of_The_Punisher_characters#Finn_Cooley "List of The
Punisher characters"), and General Nikolai Zakharov.[52]

Jigsaw's role in "Girls in White Dresses" was regarded as generic and
anticlimactic, and his inclusion in the [MAX](/wiki/Max_\(comics\) "Max
\(comics\)") imprint criticized as obtrusive and gratuitous, by Jesse Schedeen
of [IGN](/wiki/IGN "IGN"), who felt that the character was "planted in this
story mainly to appeal to fans of [the recent movie](/wiki/Punisher:_War_Zone
"Punisher: War Zone")".[53][54]

### Marvel
Noir[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=9
"Edit section: Marvel Noir")]

Jigsaw is [Al Capone](/wiki/Al_Capone "Al Capone")'s top assassin in
_[Punisher Noir](/wiki/Marvel_Noir "Marvel Noir")_. He,
[Barracuda](/wiki/Barracuda_\(comics\) "Barracuda \(comics\)"), and [the
Russian](/wiki/Russian_\(comics\) "Russian \(comics\)") are hired to kill
Frank Castelione, a grocer who had defied mob boss [Dutch
Schultz](/wiki/Dutch_Schultz "Dutch Schultz").[55] Years later, Frank's son,
the Punisher, tries to ambush Jigsaw, but is shot unconscious, and has his
skull-face mask removed. Jigsaw takes the Punisher to his lair, and tortures
him by carving a skull into the Punisher's chest. After Jigsaw mentions who
helped him and Barracuda murder Frank, the Punisher escapes his bonds, and
kills Jigsaw by [garroting](/wiki/Garrote "Garrote").[56]

## In other
media[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: In other media")]

###
Television[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=11
"Edit section: Television")]

![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/f/f2/Edit-clear.svg/40px-Edit-clear.svg.png) |  This section's plot summary **may be[too long](/wiki/Wikipedia:How_to_write_a_plot_summary#What_to_cut "Wikipedia:How to write a plot summary") or [excessively detailed](/wiki/Wikipedia:How_to_write_a_plot_summary "Wikipedia:How to write a plot summary").** Please [help improve it](//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit) by removing unnecessary details and making it more concise. _(December 2017)_ _([Learn how and when to remove this template message](/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal "Help:Maintenance template removal"))_  
---|---  
  
  * [Ben Barnes](/wiki/Ben_Barnes_\(actor\) "Ben Barnes \(actor\)") portrays Billy Russo in _[The Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(TV_series\) "The Punisher \(TV series\)")_.[57] Russo is Castle's former best friend who served alongside him in the [Marine Corps](/wiki/United_States_Marine_Corps "United States Marine Corps") [Force Reconnaissance](/wiki/Force_Recon "Force Recon") as a [Scout Sniper](/wiki/Scout_Sniper "Scout Sniper"), with 129 confirmed kills. After he left the Marines, Russo started Anvil, his own private military contracting firm.[58] In his youth, his mother was a meth addict and he was put in a foster home. Russo was nearly molested as a child, but he managed to defend himself.[59] He joined the Marine Corps and befriended Castle, who called him "The Beaut" due to his good looks. In reality, Russo and Castle are working for an illegal black ops program set up by [William Rawlins](/wiki/William_Rawlins "William Rawlins"). After a botched mission results in the deaths of several of their squadmates, Russo transfers out of the unit and suggests that Castle do the same.[60] In the present day, Russo is still friends with [Curtis Hoyle](/wiki/Curtis_Hoyle "Curtis Hoyle"), though he is unaware that Frank is still alive. DHS agent Dinah Madani begins interviewing and questioning Russo about his association with Frank, a person of interest in a case she investigated in Afghanistan.[61] Russo seduces Madani and enters a relationship with her,[62] but is irked when he learns that she is investigating Frank and that he is still living. He reunites with Castle and tries to persuade him to start a new life, but Castle refuses. However, Russo is revealed to be in league with Rawlins.[63] Russo and Rawlins plot to get rid of Castle and anyone who could link them to Kandahar. Russo kills Colonel Morty Bennett, who helped them smuggle heroin in the bodies of KIAs, after using him as bait for Castle.[64] Russo and several Anvil contractors are then tricked by Dinah into following a false lead on Castle with the intent to execute him, resulting in a shootout. However, Russo escapes after stabbing Dinah's partner Sam Stein to death.[59] Dinah, having learned the contractors were all working for Anvil, realizes Russo's complicity in Stein's murder when Frank shows up at a hotel to thwart an assassination attempt on [Karen Page](/wiki/Karen_Page "Karen Page") and Senator Stan Ori, who Russo is providing armed protection for.[65] Russo and Rawlins later capture Castle, but Russo double crosses Rawlins and leaves him at Frank's mercy.[66] He later has a showdown with Castle at the carousel where the latter's family died. The fight ends with Castle repeatedly slamming Billy's face into a carousel mirror, maiming him. Russo is last seen in a hospital bed with his head wrapped in bandages, with Castle being informed that Russo has suffered severe head trauma and blood loss, and may suffer serious memory loss if he ever wakes up.[67]

###
Film[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=12
"Edit section: Film")]

  * Jigsaw was present in early drafts of the 2004 _[Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(2004_film\) "The Punisher \(2004 film\)")_ film,[68] and was going to be included in the unproduced sequel _The Punisher 2_.[69]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/02/War_Zone_Jigsaw.jpg/220px-
War_Zone_Jigsaw.jpg)](/wiki/File:War_Zone_Jigsaw.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:War_Zone_Jigsaw.jpg "Enlarge")

[Dominic West](/wiki/Dominic_West "Dominic West") as Jigsaw in the 2008 film
_Punisher: War Zone_.

  * [Dominic West](/wiki/Dominic_West "Dominic West") portrayed Jigsaw in the 2008 film _[Punisher: War Zone](/wiki/Punisher:_War_Zone "Punisher: War Zone")_ , which changed the character's real name to **Billy "The Beaut" Russoti**. Russoti is introduced attending a mob dinner, which the Punisher attacks. Russoti escapes the ensuing massacre, but is pursued to his recycling plant, where he falls into a glass crusher, and is mangled when the Punisher turns the machine on. Billy survives, but his plastic surgeon is unable to restore his mutilated visage, stating that Russoti's facial muscles, tendons, skin, and bone structure were damaged beyond repair. After killing the surgeon, Russotti rechristens himself "Jigsaw". He then breaks his brother, James "Loony Bin Jim" Russoti, out of an asylum, to assist him in getting revenge on the Punisher. In the final battle at the Brad Street Hotel, Jigsaw is impaled and thrown into a fire by the Punisher.[70]

### Video
games[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=13
"Edit section: Video games")]

  * Jigsaw is a [boss](/wiki/Boss_\(video_gaming\) "Boss \(video gaming\)") in the 1990 _[Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(1990_video_game\) "The Punisher \(1990 video game\)")_ game for the [NES](/wiki/Nintendo_Entertainment_System "Nintendo Entertainment System"),[71] and is the final opponent in the game's 1991 [Game Boy](/wiki/Game_Boy "Game Boy") port _[The Punisher: The Ultimate Payback!](/wiki/The_Punisher:_The_Ultimate_Payback! "The Punisher: The Ultimate Payback!")_[72]

  * Jigsaw is a target in one of the missions in the 1990 DOS PC game _[The Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(1990_computer_game\) "The Punisher \(1990 computer game\)")_. Before the mission, [Microchip](/wiki/Microchip_\(comics\) "Microchip \(comics\)") informs Castle that Jigsaw and his accomplice, Mark Ruffknuckles, have escaped from Ryker's Island prison and were last seen at a seedy bar. The Punisher interrogates the bartender, who says Jigsaw and Ruffknuckles are hiding at the [Kingpin](/wiki/Kingpin_\(comics\) "Kingpin \(comics\)")'s former apartment. Castle kills Jigsaw's bodyguards at the apartment and confronts Jigsaw, who insults the Punisher: "I haven't forgot what you did to my face, Punisher. Now you will suffer worse than I did. I'm gonna carve you up so bad, I'll look like [Mel Gibson](/wiki/Mel_Gibson "Mel Gibson") compared to you!" The Punisher guns down Jigsaw, then Ruffknuckles, who is hiding in the bathroom. The Trust pays Castle well for killing Jigsaw.[73]

  * In the 1993 _[Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(arcade_game\) "The Punisher \(arcade game\)")_ video game, Jigsaw is a sub-boss in the game's sixth and final stage, where he is fought inside of a moving elevator within the Kingpin's hideout, and is armed with an [M16 rifle](/wiki/M16_rifle "M16 rifle").[74]

  * A character based on Jigsaw appears in the 2005 _[Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(2005_video_game\) "The Punisher \(2005 video game\)")_ video game, voiced by [Darryl Kurylo](/wiki/Darryl_Kurylo "Darryl Kurylo"). Here, Jigsaw is **John Saint** , the son of Howard Saint (the primary antagonist of the 2004 _[Punisher](/wiki/The_Punisher_\(2004_film\) "The Punisher \(2004 film\)")_ film and the man responsible for the death of Frank Castle's family). The explosion at the end of the film did not kill him, but instead launched him through a window and disfigured his face. Under the name Jigsaw, he takes up his father's old business, and vows revenge on the Punisher. He is also the lieutenant of a [Yakuza](/wiki/Yakuza "Yakuza")-offshoot called the Eternal Sun, and is the final boss of the game, using stolen [Stark Armor](/wiki/Iron_Man%27s_armor "Iron Man's armor") to attack the Punisher on Ryker's Island. Upon being defeated, Jigsaw is thrown out of a helicopter by the Punisher.[75]

  * Jigsaw is a playable character in the [PlayStation Network](/wiki/PlayStation_Network "PlayStation Network") [downloadable](/wiki/Downloadable "Downloadable") game _[The Punisher: No Mercy](/wiki/The_Punisher:_No_Mercy "The Punisher: No Mercy")_ , released in 2009.[76]

###
Toys[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Jigsaw_\(Marvel_Comics\)&action=edit&section=14
"Edit section: Toys")]

  * In 2006, Jigsaw was one of the figures in the second wave of the [Marvel Legends](/wiki/Marvel_Legends "Marvel Legends") "Face-Off" series. He was paired with the Punisher and came in two versions, one with a business suit and one with a Punisher costume. The two-pack was released in December 2006.[77]

  * In 2008, a minimates boxset was announced that is based on the _Punisher: War Zone_ film. The boxset features civilian Frank Castle (the Punisher), Jigsaw, and Loony Bin Jim, Jigsaw's mental, cannibalistic killer brother. The toys also come with mini weapons. They are sculpted and designed by Art Asylum and feature 14 points of articulation as well as accessories from the film.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

  * In 2009, [Hasbro](/wiki/Hasbro "Hasbro") released a Jigsaw figure in its [Mighty Muggs](/wiki/Mighty_Muggs "Mighty Muggs") toy line, which came with a silver pistol.
